alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 10:39AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .Historic rainfall from Hurricane Ian will cause levels along the Saint Johns river to remain high as rainfall moves downstream through the basin. The forecast point at Sanford has risen above the previous Record Flood Stage and will continue to rise with a forecast crest of 8.9 to 9.0 feet tonight or Saturday. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts this weekend and into next week. For the St. Johns River...including Sanford...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This exceeds the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Sanford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding becomes more signficant to the Sanford waterfront area. Water approaches low lying areas on the waterfront. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Friday was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.9 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed St Johns River Sanford 5.5 8.9 Fri 9 am 8.9 8.8 8.8 8.7 8.5 &&
